result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alberto Arquimides Mayrena Palacios

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 18, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

9:36 AM Prosecuting attorney Natalia J Gess in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Alberto Mayrena Palacios not in court.  Attorney Glenn Edward Avena in court for Alberto Mayrena Palacios.  Court states cases and appearances.  Atty Avena states DE thought this was set for tomorrow -  notes this is resolved w/an ordinance violation.  Requests 60 day reset for an internal review noting it will be resolved.  State doesn't object.  Court agrees and will have an internal review set on all matters in about 60 days.  21TR7672, 21TR7673 and 21TR7671 to track.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.

01:18 PM Defendant Alberto Arquimides Mayrena Palacios in court with attorney Eric Cadill o/b/o Glenn Edward Avena and interpreter Fred S..  Gabriel David Arevalo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Will be resolved requesting a plea/sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Return date on April 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Pre-trial conference on March 4, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Return date on April 27, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

01:09 PM Defendant Alberto Arquimides Mayrena Palacios in court with attorney Eric Caudill o/b/o Glenn Avena and Interpreter, Fred S - S&T.  Gabriel David Arevalo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Atty Caudill enters not gulity plea.  File set for pre-trial conference/return date.  Bond continues.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 4, 2022 at 09:45 am.  Return date scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
